task.title: Troubleshooting non-reporting clusters
task.shortdesc: Immediate actions to take when a cluster is not reporting.

context.p: If you installed a cluster but it is not reporting in response to the polling sequence, it might be due to the configuration or operation of the cluster hardware or the activation of the cluster environment.

Some of the ways you can tell the cluster is not reporting properly are the following:
The cluster issues reporting messages with identifiers that do not correspond to a recognized list within
The cluster fails to issue a reporting message in reponse to a scheduled, or a forced, polling sequence
The cluster only intermittantly issues reporting messages

step.cmd: In the interface to the execution cluster, open host.params and locate HOSTS_PENDING_REASON_UPDATE_INTERVAL.
Verify the submission cluster reporting schedule is set to a valid interval.

substep.cmd: In Configuratoin Tool Schedule task, select the applicable submission cluster.

ul.li: If the Interval settings option is set to Custom settings, check that all the reporting settings are correct, and then click Apply.
If the Interval settings option is set to Inherit from Parent, continue with the next substep.

substep.cmd: In the Relationships task, select the Parent.
In the Default settings section, make sure the Reporting intervals is set to Synchronize, and that the reporting Mode is not set to Off.
Specify the reporting interval, in seconds.

info.p: Zero seconds disables the pending reason.

substep.stepresult: The issue has been resolved if the cluster successfully responds to the polling sequence. If this does not happen, proceed to the next step.

step.cmd: In the Interval settings menu, confirm that the reporting mode is set to dynamic.

substep.cmd: In the Interval settings menu, select the applicable submission cluster.
Verify the reporting mode is set to the dynamic.
substep.info: If the reporting mode is set to the scheduled, then the cluster will only report at specific times which may not align with the reporting poll schedule.

substep.stepresult: The issue has been resolved if the cluster successfully responds to the polling sequence. If this does not happen, proceed to the next step.
